intro: Maerua macrocarpa, commonly known as the large-fruited maerua, is a shrub or small tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces large, woody fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by animals. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky soils. Maerua macrocarpa is also valued for its role in traditional medicine and as a source of fodder for livestock.
